snippet: A live television show on China’s national broadcaster on Friday displayed four foreign drug traffickers, convicted of murder, being led to their executions.
abstract: Chinese government sends four foreign drug traffickers to their deaths after convicting them of killing 13 Chinese sailors during two-hour television broadcast; live program becomes instantly polarizing sensation, with viewership divided about broadcast.

byline.contributor: Shi Da and Patrick Zuo contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A live television show on China’s national broadcaster on Friday displayed four foreign drug traffickers, convicted of murder, being led to their executions.

headline.seo: Chinese TV Special on Executions Stirs Debate
headline.main: Divided Chinese See a Live TV Program About Executions as Crass, or Cathartic
headline.print_headline: Divided Chinese See a Live TV Program About Executions as Crass, or Cathartic
